Description: Pen case (with associated ink bottle, Af1892,0216.21.b) made of brass with engraved pattern.
Curator's comments: This double cylindered pen-case of silver and brass has an attached octagonal inkwell and a pendant intended to bring its owner good fortune and protection from harm.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
Acquisition notes: 1892,0216.1 to 28 is a miscellaneous group of material given by A W Franks. Most is European; nos 20 and 21 are the only pieces from Africa.
